ratings.comment: He was the TA for Math 340 and his discussions were useless. He would do 2-3 homework questions and write out the solutions to them and that was it. He would never check to see if anyone actually understood what was being done or what should be done next. He also graded the homework very difficultly.

Jae-Ho was great! Professor Miller's lectures were pointless, so most of my learning came from Jae-Ho. He actually CARED if we learned the material, and used homework problems as examples. His quizzes only tested on the basic concepts which was nice. Overall a great TA!

Jaeho had a really difficult time communicating with the class. The first test had an average grade of a "D" for his section. He was hard to find during office hours and failed to explain difficult problems. I would strongly recommend trying to find another T.A. if you're signed up with Jaeho. Switching would be well worth the effort!
bottom line: if he is your TA, transfer as soon as you can. you can hardly understand him, very poor TA. He made the rudimentary subject of algebra extremely challenging.
